intro: Ryania speciosa var. mutisii, commonly known as the yellow ryania, is a tropical shrub native to South America, particularly found in regions of Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their antipyretic and analgesic properties, while the plant also has ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
